thig6.4:4.1: I was adorned with jewelry and all dressed up,
thig6.4:4.2: with garlands, and sandalwood makeup piled on,
thig6.4:5.2: staples and dainties in no small amount,
thig6.4:5.4: and betook myself to the park.
thig6.4:6.1: I enjoyed myself there and played about,
thig6.4:6.2: and then, returning to my own home,
thig6.4:6.4: and so I entered the Añjana grove at Sāketa.
thig6.4:7.1: Seeing the light of the world,
thig6.4:7.2: I paid homage and sat down.
thig6.4:7.4: the seer taught me the Dhamma.
thig6.4:8.1: When I heard the great hermit,
thig6.4:8.3: Right there I encountered the Dhamma,
thig6.4:9.1: Then, having understood the true teaching,
thig6.4:9.4: the Buddha’s bidding was not in vain.
